meanings.definition: To underestimate the value or importance of something.
meanings.sent1: Some people underrate the power of kindness.
meanings.sent2: It is easy to underrate the impact of a simple smile.
meanings.sent3: Don't underrate the magic of a genuine compliment.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of noise, the quiet acts of kindness should not be underrated.
meanings.sent5: Never underrate the positive influence you can have on someone's day.

meanings.definition: To assign too low a value or rating to something.
meanings.sent1: I tend to underrate my own abilities.
meanings.sent2: It's important not to underrate the quality of your work.
meanings.sent3: He always underrates his cooking skills, but everyone loves his meals.
meanings.sent4: She underrates her worth, not realizing how valuable she truly is.
meanings.sent5: Never underrate the importance of self-belief in achieving your goals.
